etymologies: Middle English (used in the plural meaning ‘genet skins’): from Old French genete, probably via Catalan, Portuguese, or Spanish from Arabic jarnaiṭ

definitions: a nocturnal, catlike mammal of the civet family with short legs, spotted fur, and a long bushy ringed tail, found in Africa, southwestern Europe, and Arabia.

notes.text: Genus Genetta, family Viverridae: several species, in particular the common genet or small-spotted genet (G. genetta)

shortDefinitions: catlike nocturnal mammal of civet family
